alert.note: Alert for Alameda; Contra Costa; San Francisco; San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 27 at 6:02AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Alameda, Contra Costa, San Francisco, San Mateo, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 900 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 601 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Jose, San Francisco, Oakland, Fremont, Hayward, Sunnyvale, Santa Clara, Berkeley, Daly City, San Mateo, San Leandro, Livermore, Redwood City, Mountain View, Alameda, San Ramon, Pleasanton, Union City, Milpitas and Palo Alto. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Alameda; Contra Costa; San Francisco; San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz
